dialogues.text: Another terrific interception by Smith. That's his second. Madden starts shuffling through pages.

dialogues.speaker: MADDEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, this guy is a player. He finds the paper he's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: MADDEN
dialogues.text: According to the Redskins, Ray Smith... is... that's weird. No college given, no high school given. It just says he's been a resident of the state of Maryland for the last four years and five months. Likes to embroider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is walking toward the huddle.     In his ear, he hears: McGINTY (V.O) Half your job is getting that huddle in the right mindset. Use your imagination, Shane. Shane stops short of the huddle.     Everyone is looking at him. There is a beat and then Shane steps in.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Okay, let's all take a few seconds to think about what we were doing for a living... just last week. Shane looks around the huddle.     Everybody looks pained and/or depressed.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Good. Let's kick ass. Red right pass 15 x hook. They break the huddle and Shane sets up over Evans. He glances over at Brian Murray. Murray is lined up in a three point stance at tight end. But his head is turned and he's looking directly at Shane. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red fifteen! Red fifteen! Hut! Shane nods on the snap. The front five, in the persons of Andre, Jamal, Reese, Mickey Lee and Cochran, hit out and simultaneously knock their men on their backs. Shane, with plenty of time, hits Murray over the middle for twelve yards. Shane looks over at the sidelines.   McGinty is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: is under pressure but he rolls smoothly and rockets the ball downfield. Murray pulls it in for fifteen yards.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: rolls left off the shotgun, fights off a cornerback and throws back across field, complete to Lamont coming out of the backfield.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: is calling for a fair catch on a punt. He catches the ball but Bateman flies INTO FRAME and decks him. Flags fly.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: are blocking side by side, pushing their men back as Lamont squeezes through with the ball.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: is pass blocking like the all pro that he is. He knocks his man flat and then doubles up on Cochran's man.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: is pursuing a running back.   He knocks down an official and runs right over him. Then he gets his hands on the running back and pushes him out of bounds and then knocks over a photographer.

dialogues.speaker: G
dialogues.text: pumps once and then drills a twenty yard spiral. Clifford Franklin beats his man and dives for the ball. He bobbles it, and then squeezes it to his stomach as he hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden uses his pen on the screen to try to explain a play. There are already lines everywhere. MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... began with a Redskin end around, but Cochran, the pulling tackle ran into Falco's pitchout ... see? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here, it bounced off his helmet. Then it was kicked by Landon and then Hayes touched it, I think, and then Green got a hand on it, and then Bellinski recovered it and then he lost it, and finally the ball took a crazy bounce right back into Falco's hands, look at his face here. He's as surprised as anybody! Falco then ran it back to just about the original line of scrimmage, executed the same play -- an end around to Murray -- and the Skins score. Welcome to Strike Football!

dialogues.speaker: ON PACIFICO
dialogues.text: Boom!   He boots the extra point. Scoreboard:    Patriots 17, Redskins 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the clock which shows one minute ten seconds left in the fourth quarter.

dialogues.speaker: ON HUDDLE
dialogues.text: It breaks and comes to the line of scrimmage. Shane drops into the shotgun. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hut, hut! Shane rolls left but there's a blitz! The cornerback is almost on him when Shane shifts and rolls the other way.

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANKLIN
dialogues.text: He's wide open five yards from the goal line.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: They're breathing down his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Franklin and cocks his arm. Suddenly, opposing jerseys are everywhere. Shane dumps the ball. He's immediately decked by a defensive end.

dialogues.speaker: ON BALL
dialogues.text: We watch the flight of it in SLOW MOTION. We FOLLOW it right INTO the hands of... a New England Patriot defensive back.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He's down and not moving.

dialogues.speaker: ON TODD, ROD AND BOB
dialogues.text: They scream in despair.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: She falls to her knees in pain. SUMMERALL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falco is intercepted. That's too bad. MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and it looks like he's hurt, too. He was really starting to put it together here in the fourth quarter. Only forty-eight seconds now left on the clock.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He's helped off the field and onto the bench. ON McGINTY He grabs Bateman before he can run out onto the field. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny. (very slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the ball. BATEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball. Okay, Coach. He runs out onto the field.

dialogues.speaker: ON PATRIOTS
dialogues.text: They line up. PATRIOT QB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hut, hut, hut! The quarterback hands off to the running back right up the middle in a typical "run out the clock" play. BAM! Bateman comes out of nowhere, decks the runner and literally rips the ball out of his hands as he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: ON CROWD
dialogues.text: They go wild!

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: She does a cartwheel. ON McGINTY He's leaning over a groggy Shane on the bench. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shake your head at me. You are going back in there. You are gonna run the same god damn play, you are gonna throw the ball to Franklin again and this time, he's gonna score. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... McGinty grabs some smelling salts from a hovering trainer. He shoves them under Shane's nose.    Shane is suddenly very awake. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the only one in this entire stadium who can do it. Do you understand me? You can do something no one else can do. So, start right here. Start living your destiny. Or give it up for good. Right here. Right now. Shane stares at him. Then he stands up, wobbles and puts on his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: ON HUDDLE
dialogues.text: They're all turned and watching as Shane makes his way slowly out onto the field. Annabelle watches him closely. SUMMERALL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes Falco with eighteen seconds left on the clock. MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised to see him again after that shot he took from Bellinski.

dialogues.speaker: ON HUDDLE
dialogues.text: It breaks and Shane stands over Evans and looks out at the defense. Nasty-looking linebackers and cornerbacks stare at him. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 green! His voice cracks and several defensive players openly laugh at him. Shane gets an idea. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check! Black 43! Black 43!

dialogues.speaker: ON ANDRE
dialogues.text: He's down in a three-point stance facing a defender. He whispers to Reese: ANDRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean? REESE (whispering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: back) He's changing the play. Listen! SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black 43! MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long count. Falco could be calling an audible.

dialogues.speaker: ON LAMONT
dialogues.text: He shifts position in the backfield. LAMONT (to Shane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this right? SHANE (shaking his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: head) Black 43 left! Lamont shifts again. Clifford goes in motion from his flanker position but then changes his mind and goes back the other way. Lamont and Clifford then bump into each other.

dialogues.speaker: ON PATRIOT DEFENSE
dialogues.text: They are totally confused now as they try to adjust to the equally confused Redskins. ON McGINTY He looks extremely pissed.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hut!   Hut! He turns to hand the ball off to Lamont but Lamont is not there. Shane turns the other way and sees Lamont just standing there looking at him. Shane runs over to him and hands him the ball. Meanwhile, the Patriot defense is going the other direction. Lamont takes off. One cornerback is not taken in. The guy dives for Lamont's legs. We hear a CLANK as the cornerback's HELMET hits Lamont's industrial KNEE BRACE. The guy bounces off and Lamont trots into the end zone. SUMMERALL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamont scores! MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Falco calls an audible at the line of scrimmage and Lamont takes it in! Shane, meanwhile, is looking at McGinty on the sidelines. McGINTY (V.O.) (in Shane's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: helmet) I guess you saw something I didn't. Shane nods vigorously. McGINTY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to bullshit me, pal. You didn't want it. Winners always want the ball with the game on the line. You know that. Shane looks down. McGINTY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. The play is... waggle right, drag hook. You understand? Shane nods.

dialogues.speaker: ON O'NEIL
dialogues.text: He looks ten years younger as he and Augustine watch. SUMMERALL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With eight seconds remaining, Pacifico will try the extra point that will send this game into overtime. MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This turned out to be one hell of a contest, Pat!

dialogues.speaker: ON PACIFICO
dialogues.text: He sets up for the kick.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He waits for the snap.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIAN MURRAY
dialogues.text: He sets up at his flanker position. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hut! Shane catches the snap and pitches the ball out to Murray from his holding position. MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fake! The Patriot right defensive end breaks through and reaches for Murray. The only person in his way is Shane, still kneeling in the holding position. Shane screams as the huge lineman trips over him and then falls on him. Murray sweeps around the right side and scores untouched. Redskins win. Everybody goes nuts.

dialogues.speaker: ON O'NEIL
dialogues.text: He pounds on Augustine.

dialogues.speaker: ON TODD, ROD AND BOB
dialogues.text: They pound on each other.     Hail to the Redskins is deafening. ON McGINTY He just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He's still under the defensive end. Reese Evans pulls the guy off and bends down to Shane. REESE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won, Shane.   We won! Shane manages a painful smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's packed with players, friends and assorted groupies. Pacifico is smoking and talking non-stop to a group who hang on his every word. Andre is already passed out at a booth. Jamal supports one side of Andre so he doesn't fall over. Murray is signing to several fans who sign back. Clifford Franklin signs autographs. Earl Wilkinson, dressed to the nines, is dancing close and slow with a gorgeous woman. Shane is at the bar and he's not in good shape. He's got cuts and bruises visible and every time he moves he grimaces. The martinis are starting to help, however. He's talking to a stunning WOMAN IN RED.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: ... ultimately, it's a pain thing, you know? I mean, it's Darwinian, the survival of the numbest. Whoever can take the pain most, gets the largest contract. It's sick. He finishes his martini and throws the olive over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: IN RED
dialogues.text: Exactly. Let me buy you another. She signals to the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN RED
dialogues.text: I don't know how you do it. I hate pain. Pain is a no no as far as I'm concerned. Shane gets his new drink, takes a sip and visibly slumps at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurring) I'm glad that you are concerned.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN RED
dialogues.text: Hey, are you    alright? I'll take you    up to your room, if    you like. Shane looks at her closely.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: I would like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane weaves down the hallway with the Woman In Red. They stop at a door.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Here's home. Shane fumbles for a key. Another stunning-looking woman suddenly appears from down the hall. This is the WOMAN IN BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN RED
dialogues.text: A friend of mine is going to join us, okay? WOMAN IN BLUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.   Ready to party? She checks the hallway, takes the key from Shane and sticks it in the lock.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: (looking at both women) Oooooh. Bookends.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN BLUE
dialogues.text: And you're the book, baby. Suddenly, Annabelle Farrell appears in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (to the girls) Go away. Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN RED
dialogues.text: Fuck off! Crack! Annabelle punches her in the nose with a straight right hand. The girl bounces off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: (to Annabelle) These are my guests.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN RED
dialogues.text: (now bleeding) You crazy bitch! Both girls take off.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Why did you do that? Annabelle opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You were about to be rolled.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: (as he enters) That's what I was hoping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle is pulling the bed down as Shane falls into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: They work the bar downstairs looking for drunk Redskins. Shane looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: I guess they found one.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Don't feel so bad. It's a rookie mistake. She turns and sees that he's already passed out. She looks at him not unkindly. Then she unbuckles his belt and starts pulling his pants off.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE'S BEAT UP FACE
dialogues.text: as he opens his eyes. He rolls over and screams in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: She's wearing nothing but a Redskins' T- shirt. She quickly bends over him. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.   Take this.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: (groaning) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: It's for the pain. Take it. It's only a little bit illegal. Shane takes it and swigs a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Oh, God. I've got to go to the bathroom. It's far away, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'll help. We'll just take our time. She helps him get out of bed.   When he stands, he screams again.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Kidneys.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Oh, man. My hair hurts.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You took a hell of a beating. The martinis didn't help, either. She walks him to the bathroom like an old man. He shuffles in and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid if you've got blood in your urine. That's normal.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Did you undress me?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: And you... slept here with me?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Did we... ?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? You were catatonic. He appears again at the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: No blood. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Back to bed. He leans on her as she walks him back. He gets into bed with a moan. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask you a personal question? She nods. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you do this for all Redskin quarterbacks? ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why me? Annabelle takes her time answering. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess I can't resist a man who can take a hit. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take a hit! Annabelle cradles his head. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. It's all in your head. Now, get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle walks up to Shane's door with a stack of newspapers. She enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door is closed.      Annabelle talks to him anyway. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the golden boy in the press this morning. She reads a headline.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: 'Falco scores big.' (to herself) Well... not really. (still reading) Hey, a lot of the regular players are starting to cross the picket line.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Redskins?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: It doesn't say. Shane comes out of the bathroom dressed and ready to go. He's still moving slowly and in great pain.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: McGinty called a dinner meeting with the whole team. Shane tries to put on his coat, but he's so sore he can't. Annabelle helps him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thanks for... everything.     You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: No. Probably just your wallet and your watch.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: And that pill, that sure worked.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You're basic double D Vicodin. But be careful: It's habit- forming. The best stuff always is. There's another awkward silence. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice both knees and that shoulder before bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford, still carrying his football, comes out of his apartment in a third floor walk- up. He's wearing his Redskins jacket. As he turns around from locking his door, he stops dead in his tracks. All of Clifford's neighbors, all the way down both halls, are standing in front of their doors. They all start applauding. Clifford smiles from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: are trying to hail a cab on Wisconsin Avenue. Suddenly, one cab, then two, then four SLAM on their BRAKES. Cabbies hop out to open their doors for the brothers.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: walks down G Street with Brian Murray. Brian spots something in a store window and stops Roland. Roland gasps as he sees himself duplicated on ten TV screens in an appliance store. He's on tape being interviewed at a Redskins' practice.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: dressed in casual chic, is moving quickly through Lord and Taylor's Department Store    with two sales clerks in tow. He stops,    grabs four cashmere sweaters, smells    them, hands them to one clerk and moves    on.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: is standing in front of the White House. He has a line of ten people who are paying five bucks for an autographed picture of himself that he hands out from a huge stack.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: We see Shane walk in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scabskins are all being served dinner in a private room. Mickey Lee is served a steak the size of a briefcase. Andre and Jamal get lobsters big enough to be pets. Ed O'Neil is being fed pureed asparagus by Augustine. When Augustine drops the napkin and bends over, O'Neil whispers urgently to Cochran who is enjoying a steak: O'NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you 50 thousand dollars for a bite of that steak! McGinty taps his glass at the head of the table and stands. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, listen up: There have been a lot of rumors about the regular players crossing the picket lines. They are not rumors. Many union players have now seen the error of their ways and are coming back in droves. Apparently, they have been struck with the realization that it is a blessing to be playing professional football. There is dead silence in the room.   Everybody thinks it's over. McGINTY But they had their chance. Now it's your turn. Mister O'Neil and I have agreed to ban all striking players and to continue to go with you guys. There's a beat and then everyone breaks into cheers. Suddenly, the door flies open and a REPORTER and a cameraman step in and start filming. The Reporter shoves a microphone at McGinty.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Coach, what will be your strategy against New York this Sunday? Out in the restaurant, patrons see the players and a few break into "Hail to the Redskins." Suddenly, the whole restaurant starts singing. Shane looks embarrassed. Pacifico stands up on his seat, and conducts the singing. Andre and Jamal hold their lobsters in the air and make them dance to the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ON a TELEVISION showing Pacifico conducting and the entire restaurant singing. Eddie Martel (Redskin quarterback) is watching the scene at home on the late local news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The Palm patrons showed an impromptu appreciation tonight for the new Washington Redskins. They may be unknowns and far from superstars, but it sure looks like they have charmed the fans. Martel looks very angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane answers his door.     Annabelle is standing there. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.    Come in. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She gives him a bottle of pills.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We don't travel with the team. So, here's Tylenol with codeine, regular Vicodins, the magic bullet one that I gave you before, and a couple of Darvons if you actually break something. Pop 'em in the ambulance. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.    Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'll be watching on TV. The Giants got back three of their four defensive linemen. Plus their middle linebacker. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I know.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What can I say? Go from the shotgun and scramble your ass off. Shane smiles at her. She suddenly grabs him and they kiss big- time. Then she breaks and walks quickly away. Shane doesn't know what to make of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're DOWN ON the field in the middle of a play. Shane is running away from three New York Giant defensive linemen. Shane is not even looking for a receiver. He's looking to save his life. Finally, he's caught by a six-foot-five, two hundred and seventy pound defensive end named HANK MORRIS, who throws him down and lands on top of him. Oooof!

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: (in Shane's ear) Hello, again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back in their booth calling the game.

dialogues.speaker: MADDEN
dialogues.text: That's all-pro Hank Morris's third sack, his second here in the fourth quarter and the sixth of the day for the Giants. Falco is gonna be sore tonight. SUMMERALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he can stay alive that long. Ten-three New York in what has turned out to be an incredible defensive duel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerome Lindell is once again outside the stadium, picketing with a smaller group of players. He does his interview on camera, standing in front of a huge semi-truck. And a big, overweight truck driver stands next to him. LINDELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... because it's about brothers, and brotherhood and standing together against the oppressors. That's why I am so grateful to our Teamster brothers who have joined us here today in New York to protest the greed squad known as the N.F.L. owners. The truck driver suddenly pumps his arm and a CACOPHONY OF TRUCK AIR HORNS GO OFF. It's deafening but Lindell smiles through it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is rolling out with Morris on his heels again. He can't find anyone open and runs out of bounds.

dialogues.speaker: IN HUDDLE
dialogues.text: Everybody is breathing hard, beat-up and exhausted. Shane leans in. SHANE (to Reese Evans)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to double up on Morris. EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too far outside for me to get to him. (to Cochran)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him down and sit on him. COCHRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's huge! He's been beating the crap out of me all day! I feel like a rag doll out here. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help this time. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Spread left 'A' Right, roll right Half Back Sail. On two. They break.   Shane sets up in the shotgun. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, fifteen.   Hut, hut! On the snap, Lee and Cochran double-team Morris. Morris slaps Cochran away like, well, a rag doll, and then confronts the Sumo master. He bumps stomachs with Lee. Lee flies through the air and lands on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He spots his receiver, he cocks his arm and wham! Morris decks him. And, of course, lands on him. Oooof! MORRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shane) It's just me, fuck- face! In order to get up, Morris puts one huge hand on Shane's helmet and pushes himself up. Shane moans as his face guard digs a four- inch hole in the turf. ON McGINTY He's talking into his mike. McGINTY You want a time-out? That looks like it hurt. Shane gets up. He's got a huge piece of turf stuck in his face guard so that for a beat, we can't even see him. Then he pulls out the dirt and grass, and we see Shane really pissed off for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Huddle up! Everyone gathers around.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Same thing... Except... (to Lee and Cochran) Let him in. Don't touch him.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVANS
dialogues.text: Shane...

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Shut up! Let him through. On two. They break the huddle.     Shane goes into a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Red fifteen. Hut! Hut! Shane does a three-step drop from the shotgun. Cochran and Lee hit out on either side of Morris, giving him a clear shot at Shane. Morris comes hard and fast. Shane looks downfield, winds up, turns and fires the ball at Morris's head. The ball goes like a bullet for five feet and then sticks like a dart in Morris's face guard. For a moment, Morris is blinded. And Shane is dumbfounded. Then Morris starts to wrestle the ball out of his mask.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Get him! Andre and Jamal grab onto Morris who starts stumbling down field with the ball still stuck in his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: MADDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Morris intercepts! Wait! The ball is stuck in his face! But Morris won't go down. He's still trying to pry the ball loose as he throws off Jamal. Then he shakes off Andre.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIAN MURRAY
dialogues.text: He's in SLOW MOTION in midair, diving towards Morris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's absolutely QUIET (he's deaf, remember?) as he soars towards Morris's head, helmet and ball. Wham! Murray's full body weight hits Morris in the helmet, which flies off and rolls across the field with the ball still stuck in it. OUT OF THE SILENCE, we suddenly hear the hit and the crowd roar. Morris goes down like a building with Murray buried in his throat.

dialogues.speaker: ON ROOM, (D.C.)
dialogues.text: Todd, Rod and Bob are destroying Todd's den in reaction to the hit.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANOTHER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Annabelle is screaming "Whoa!" to that hit.

dialogues.speaker: ON O'NEIL AND AUGUSTINE
dialogues.text: They're watching ON TV.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Now that's a hit!

dialogues.speaker: ON BALL AND HELMET
dialogues.text: It's in the very chubby hands of Mickey Lee, who is rumbling downfield with the fumble/helmet recovery. New York players have been slow to pick this up because they, too, have been admiring the lick that Murray put on Morris. Suddenly, the whole team is chasing Lee. They catch him pretty easily at the twenty, but Lee represents a lot of weight. Lee staggers across the ten, shaking players off left and right. One defensive halfback sacrifices himself and throws himself at Lee's feet. Lee trips over the guy, gains his footing again, walks on the guy (who screams in agony) and falls into the end zone carrying three players with him.

dialogues.speaker: ON MADDEN AND SUMMERALL
dialogues.text: John is beside himself. MADDEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee scores! Lee scores! Lee scores! I love to see a fat guy score!

dialogues.speaker: ON LEE
dialogues.text: He gets up in jubilation, spikes the ball/helmet combination, and runs through the back of the end zone. But he doesn't stop. He's aiming for a low wall that separates the first row of fans from the field.

dialogues.speaker: ON FOUR FANS
dialogues.text: They see Mickey rumbling at them and they all get the picture at the same time. They scream!

dialogues.speaker: ON MICKEY
dialogues.text: He launches himself into the stands in ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: ON FOUR FANS
dialogues.text: Crunch!     Lee lands on all four of them.

dialogues.speaker: ON FOOTBALL
dialogues.text: It's hiked into Shane's hands and Pacifico boots the extra point.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: "Giants 10 -- Redskins 10 TIME REMAINING: 58 seconds."

dialogues.speaker: ON SIDELINE
dialogues.text: Murray and Lee are getting congratulations from everyone.

dialogues.speaker: PACIFICO
dialogues.text: (to Murray) What a hit! (slower) What a hit! Murray nods that he understands.

dialogues.speaker: EVANS
dialogues.text: (to Murray) I'm proud of you, kid. Jamal and Andre are hugging Lee. In the b.g., we can see paramedics lifting one of Lee's four fans onto a stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRE
dialogues.text: You're the one, you're the one, you're the one...

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: You think that's worth a shoe deal? McGinty walks into the middle of it. McGINTY Stop with the lovefest! Let's get the goddamn ball back and win this thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're CLOSE ON Bateman as he lines up for the kick-off. Everybody in the stadium knows that an on-side kick is coming. Bateman is standing in the hot spot for recovering the ball. Shane and everyone with decent hands is on the field. Pacifico lines it up and boots it ten yards. The ball takes a crazy hop, hits a Giant, and ricochets off him. Bateman runs over two guys and grabs the ball on the bounce. He's got it. But Bateman doesn't go down. He turns and starts running across the field. Shane runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: No! Danny, go down! You're using up the clock! But Bateman likes this new job: kick-off returner! Especially after he runs over a Giant and stiff-arms another. Bateman is finally trapped on the far sideline after gaining perhaps eight yards. So, he turns and starts running back the other way. Shane has been chasing him and now sees Bateman running back at him. Shane has no choice but to throw himself in front of Bateman's legs. Bateman goes down. Shane jumps up:

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: (to ref) Time out! Bateman looks up at Shane.

dialogues.speaker: BATEMAN
dialogues.text: Beautiful tackle, Shane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's something you don't see everyday!

dialogues.speaker: ON CLOCK
dialogues.text: Bateman has burned up most of the clock. Eighteen seconds remain.

dialogues.speaker: ON SIDELINE
dialogues.text: McGinty, Shane and Pacifico confer. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got time for one play, but if we don't get it out of bounds, the game is over. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you're looking at a sixty-five yard kick from here. PACIFICO (smoking a butt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously? PACIFICO (to Shane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hold it. I'll kick it. McGinty looks at Shane and they both shrug. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck.

dialogues.speaker: ON SUMMERALL AND MADDEN
dialogues.text: Madden can't believe it. MADDEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it! McGinty is gonna let Pacifico try the field goal from sixty-five yards out! SUMMERALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, John, this kid has got a heck of a foot. STRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sixty-five yards? Come on!

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He's set up to receive the snap. Pacifico lines himself up the way soccer- style kickers do. Then he takes a drag on his smoke, and flicks it away. MADDEN    (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat... did he    just? I think that guy    is smoking on the    field! SUMMERALL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think you imagined that one, John. Shane looks at Pacifico and his clean uniform. Then Shane looks at his own uniform which is covered with blood, dirt, and grass stains. Pacifico looks clean. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great, Lou, you know that? Pacifico is really touched. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Thanks, Shane. That means a lot to me. Shane turns to Evans who smiles at him between his own legs. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hut! The snap is perfect.    Pacifico boots the shit out of it.

dialogues.speaker: ON BALL
dialogues.text: End over end, yard after yard, it flies straight and true. MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's straight enough! If it's got the distance, it's... The ball hits the crossbar and goes over. MADDEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!     Redskins win! Everybody goes crazy. Players are pounding on Pacifico. But Pacifico is desperately looking around for someone. He spots him: It's Bateman running flat-out across the field to congratulate him. Pacifico runs for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane knocks. After a beat, the door opens and Annabelle is standing there rubbing her eyes. She's wearing a cut-off Redskin jersey. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     Not really. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting used to being slapped around. That's a good sign. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: Nothing comes out. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come in and make love?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Yes. No. I'm here because ... I don't want to be alone. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most    of the world feels that    way. You don't have    to be embarrassed about    it.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: But to tell you the truth... I'm kind of scared of you. Annabelle takes that in and thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I won't hurt you. She takes his hand and leads him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle is giving Shane a slow, sensuous, full-body massage. It's lucky for us he's on his stomach. Shane does a lot of moaning as Annabelle's fingers work their magic. She gets to a place on his shoulder that's especially tender. He moans even louder.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: That shoulder is going to need special handling. Annabelle pulls her jersey off and gently presses her breasts into Shane's back. Shane puts a pillow over his head to drown out the ecstasy. After a beat, he pulls the pillow away.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: You know what hurts worse than my shoulder?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I can't imagine.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Their defensive end punched me in the mouth. Annabelle starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Seriously. It's killing me. Annabelle is laughing hard now as Shane rolls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane and Annabelle are in a close, after-sex kind of cuddle thing. Shane is unburdening himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: ... after that game, after being beaten that badly in front of the whole country, after humiliating myself, my team, my school, my family, I mean -- did you know that I set two Sugar Bowl records?! I was sacked eleven times! I threw six interceptions! ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Anyway, after that, I could never seem to adjust in the pros. I was too scared. I lost my balls. We see Annabelle's hand move slightly under the covers.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Well, they're back.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. My nerve. I lost the edge you need to play this game.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I don't believe that. I don't think it just goes away. It was only one bad day, Shane. Everybody has those.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: No. Somehow, I convinced myself that I couldn't ever win the big game. I got so down, that I was afraid to be playing when a game was on the line. I was afraid to screw up. That's the sure sign of a loser. From there, it wasn't very far to thinking that I'll never win, that I didn't deserve to win at anything. Including love.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You're wrong. You're winning now. You're winning me. They kiss real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a huge town house in Foggy Bottom.    Its entrance is now lined with REPORTERS. One is speaking ON CAMERA to his anchor.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Bob, I'm standing in front of Redskins owner, Edward Frances O'Neil's home and all we know right now is that the Washington player previously known as Ray Smith is in fact Earl Samuel Wilkinson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see two photographs of Earl: One with his current beard and the other, his clean-shaven mug shot of five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: ... the All Pro Miami Safety who was serving five to seven years in the Maryland state penitentiary for three counts of aggravated assault. As you may recall, one of those counts was against a Baltimore City police officer and resulted in that officer being hospitalized for quite some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing his sports segment from the studio.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Any idea how Wilkinson's identity was discovered and who leaked it to the media?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: No, Bob, but rumor has it that the National Football League Player's Association had something to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Thanks, Hank. (TO CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other N.F.L. news, almost sixty percent of the regular players have now crossed the picket lines and more are crossing every day. The strike, now in its second week, is expected to go out with a fizzle. Most experts think that the Monday night Dallas/Washington game will be the last with replacement players. But even that game will feature at least 75 percent of the regular Cowboys. Coach James McGinty will try to make it a perfect three and O with a team made up totally of replacement players. Well... and one felon. (pause) That we know of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McGinty stares out the window at the reporters as Augustine feeds O'Neil soup. McGINTY Stop worrying. The N.F.L. doesn't care if he played under an assumed name. Everything was legal. He was let out on a work release program. He'll be kept under house arrest but he'll still be able to play.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Where are we gonna keep him? McGINTY In the stadium. We'll fix up something comfortable for him and he'll get his exercise by kicking the shit out of N.F.L. receivers.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: How did you pull that off? McGINTY How else? With your money.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: (to Augustine) Take this cow piss out of here.

dialogues.speaker: AUGUSTINE
dialogues.text: You used to love asparagus soup. They say that when the taste buds go, you're at the beginning of the end. Augustine leaves with the tray. McGINTY I want to keep Falco after the strike ends. As Martel's back-up.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Let's keep 'em all. The hell with the regulars. McGINTY You've got to take the union players back once the strike ends. It's part of the collective bargaining agreement.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: The hell I do! I'm dying! Let 'em sue me. McGINTY They'll do worse than that. They'll close down the stadium. O'NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn 'em! Then you got to beat Dallas. The whole country will be watching. All those millionaires down there deserve to have their noses rubbed in it. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, let's be honest: beating Dallas is gonna be a hell of a trick. O'NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can pull it    off. You proved that    winning doesn't have to    look pretty. These     boys are hungry for it,    Jimmy. (MORE) O'NEIL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothin' more dangerous in all of sports than a hungry team. I remember back in '47, we were playing Nebraska in the mud... McGINTY (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, I'm begging you -- no Notre Dame stories. O'NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jimmy, okay. But you beat Dallas for me, and then I'll go gently into that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ON    Mickey Lee, who is wearing his Redskin    game jersey with no pads. He's stuffed    into a Cadillac Brougham, a big-ass version    of the Caddy. He's talking directly TO US. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll score, too, with a Cadillac from Coleman Cadillac. It's a big car for a big man. Mickey is very wooden as a spokesperson.    He tries again. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (same thing) You'll score, too, with a Cadillac from Coleman's Cadillac. It's a big car for a big man. DIRECTOR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good, Mickey, that's real good. Let's try it again. Mickey looks game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre, Jamal, Brian Murray, Roland Lamont, Daniel Bateman, Lou Pacifico and Shane are standing outside the stadium after practice. They are all mobbed by autograph seekers. All of them are signing as fast as they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are on the grounds of the Washington Monument. They are lined up against a bunch of little kids. Shane takes the snap. (The ball is a miniature rubber football.) All the linemen fall down. The kids blitz and sack Shane for a big loss. Annabelle watches and laughs and claps.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: still crammed into the Cadillac.   He looks exhausted and pissed. LEE (in a monotone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll score, too, with a Cadillac from Coleman Cadillac. It's a big car, for a big man. DIRECTOR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good. That was good. Let's try it again... LEE (exploding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I'm not doing it again! Who are you, Orson Welles?! This is nuts! Lee tries unsuccessfully to get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: are lined up in Redskin jerseys, minus pads. It's team picture day and everyone looks happy to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane walks down the hall to his room.        He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in and closes the door. When he turns around, Eddie Martel, ex- Washington Redskin quarterback, is sitting on Shane's bed. Two defensive linemen-types stand by the window. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: This is a visit.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: A visit. Who let you in?

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: I used to nail one of the housekeepers.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Lucky girl.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: (pointing to the linemen) You know who these guys are, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Dallas Cowboys.     Howdy.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: You'll be seeing a lot of these guys tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: Who, me? Not much. But these boys wanted a little head start on you. There's a beat and then Shane suddenly bolts for the door. But the two linemen grab and hold him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: I'm flattered that you actually think we have a chance to win.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: It can be a game of luck. And under no circumstances can we allow a scab team to go three and O. Especially against the Dallas Cowboys. It's just not good for the game.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Is the union behind this 'visit'?

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: I can't really say, Shane. By the way, have you ever tried throwing a football with bruised ribs? He kicks Shane viciously in the side.     Shane screams.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: The pain makes it damn near impossible. The linemen drops Shane on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: And one other thing: I want you to stay away from Annabelle. Shane is gasping on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: The sad fact is she won't give me the time of day. But you can't have everything I want. I can't let that happen. So, you gotta stop seeing her. Just on principle. Martel viciously kicks Shane again.     Shane screams.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: Let me hear you say it. Shane is trying to get his breath.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: Come on. You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: (barely visible) I won't go out with her anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MARTEL
dialogues.text: Good. (to the linemen) Gentlemen? (to Shane) Hey, have a great game! They move toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, fans stream into the parking lots. In a corner of a lot, Jerome Lindell is once again holding forth ON CAMERA. But this time, he's standing with a hard- looking guy in a suit, named MATHESON.

dialogues.speaker: LINDELL
dialogues.text: I think that Mister Matheson here, and myself, are very close to an agreement that will put the 'pro' back in pro-football.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Mister Matheson, what are the sticking points in the negotiations as far as the owners are concerned?

dialogues.speaker: MATHESON
dialogues.text: Only one: that the players immediately go back to work with no change in the existing contract. Lindell looks uncomfortable.   But he smiles anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar "MONDAY NIGHT FOOTBALL THEME SONG" is just ending. AL MICHAELS does his on camera intro.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Good evening from the Big O here in Washington D.C. where the mighty Dallas Cowboys take on the Cinderella Washington 'Scabskins' as they have come to be known. Hi, I'm Al Michaels and we are witnesses to a unique matchup tonight as Shane Falco and a contingent of strike players go up against the entire regular squad of the Dallas Cowboys. Yes, you heard right: every Cowboy has now crossed the picket line, some as late as this afternoon, and they will all play tonight. Can a rag tag group of hasbeens and castoffs stand up to what was once called America's team? And what about the strike itself? It has been so ineffective that many predict it will be over before this game ends. Stay tuned as Boomer and Dan join me for strike ball, D.C. style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Martel, Wilson Jones and other regular Redskins take their seats on the fifty yard line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is just about dressed in their uniforms and ready to go. Lou Pacifico enters in street clothes and starts undressing quickly. He looks worried. Shane watches Lou for a beat. We see Shane shift his upper body and grimace. McGinty enters and pulls Shane aside. McGINTY Congratulations. It's official. You're staying on after the strike. Shane smiles in spite of the pain. McGINTY It's probably better that you not say anything to the rest of the guys until after the game. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Coach. McGinty walks into the middle of the locker room and goes into pre-game speech mode. McGINTY Alright, listen up. The strike is just about history. By tomorrow, you will no longer be Redskins. It's important that you leave here, however, with the knowledge that you have made a difference in your own life, in the owner's life -- or what's left of it -- and especially the fans'. You have proven to a skeptical America that sports is not about contracts, or agents or shoe deals. Sports is about rising to the occasion. We have one more opportunity tonight to do that, one more chance to show what heart is all about. The Dallas Cowboys are waiting out there to kill you. I expect nothing less than for you to win even in your death throes. We have a powerful weapon on our side tonight: there is no tomorrow for most of you. And that makes you very dangerous people. Use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom! Pacifico belts the kick-off deep into the end zone. Touchback.

dialogues.speaker: ON AL, DAN AND BOOMER
dialogues.text: The three hosts sit in shirtsleeves and ties, headphones on. AL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That    is one    very big leg    on Lou    Pacifico. He's    a big    reason why this    strike    team is two and    0.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: But the fact is, a kicker does not an offense make. I think tonight the Scabskins will have a very rude awakening.

dialogues.speaker: BOOMER
dialogues.text: But you have to admit, Dan, Falco is proving to be the real thing. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Boomer, no, I don't have to admit anything. BOOMER (rolling his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eyes) Here we go... Everybody laughs politely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bam! Earl Wilkinson flattens a Dallas punt returner. He's now wearing a jersey with his real name on the back.

dialogues.speaker: ON TODD, ROD AND BOB
dialogues.text: Bob is dressed in a striped convict suit with Wilkinson's number on it. He gets high fives from Todd and Rod for Wilkinson's hit.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He walks out onto the field to join the huddle. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane! He turns and sees a smiling Annabelle. Shane gives her a guilty wave and then cringes with the pain of just having to lift his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ON LINE OF SCRIMMAGE
dialogues.text: The Redskins line up. Cochran is opposite Butler, the big tackle that "visited" Shane's room. COCHRAN (to Butler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to say what an honor it is to play opposite you. And if it's not too much trouble, I would love to have your autograph. BUTLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. SHANE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hut!   Hut! On the snap, Butler bashes Cochran's head with his forearm and knocks his helmet off. Then he runs over him.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He under-throws a very weak-looking pass to Lamont. Shane grits his teeth against the pain.

dialogues.speaker: ON COCHRAN
dialogues.text: He's dazed and still on the ground. Butler walks over and bends down to him. BUTLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna autograph your body with bruises, you scab-ass son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is in the backfield, once again running for his life. He's rolling left with Butler on his heels. He throws another weak incomplete pass to Murray. Shane is crushed by Butler after he throws the ball. BUTLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that side feel? SHANE (grimacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Christmas morning. Butler leans on Shane's side as he gets up. Shane gasps with pain. ON McGINTY He's watching Shane closely.   Then he talks into his mike. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with your arm? Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: ON AL, DAN AND BOOMER
dialogues.text: They're watching the replay on their monitor. Dan is very happy. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What pursuit! Butler never gave up on him. That's a 270-pound guy who moves like a halfback. BOOMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan, I think Butler's hit on Falco was late, to tell you the truth. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course you do. You were a wimp quarterback. AL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, guys. Some laughter.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Boom! The Dallas kicker puts away the extra point after a score.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: Dallas 7, Washington 0.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: is under pressure as he rolls out. When a defensive lineman gets close, he throws the ball away like we've seen him do before. A defensive back intercepts. Dallas's ball.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: Boom! The ball goes through the uprights for a Dallas field goal.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: Dallas 10, Washington 0.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: massages O'Neil's feet as the old man watches the game. He looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: smokes and stalks the sidelines. He looks up into the stands and sees the mafioso type looking down at him.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: steps up in the pocket. He looks downfield but in the face of the pass rush, he throws the ball weakly out of bounds.

dialogues.speaker: G
dialogues.text: is pass-blocking but the first guy spins him around and the second guy runs right around him.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: is double-teamed on a pass rush. He spins but he can get no leverage against his opponents. When the play ends, he pushes one of them. A penalty flag flies by.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: takes a    pitch out, is immediately hit hard and    loses the ball. A cornerback picks it    up and takes it all the way for a Dallas    score.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: steps up and bats a ball away from a Dallas receiver. A flag flies. Wilkinson argues the call.

dialogues.speaker: K
dialogues.text: is lined up across    from Butler. On the snap, Butler slaps    Cochran in the face mask with his big,    fat club of a hand. Cochran disappears    OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Boom! The Dallas kicker puts away the extra point after a Dallas touchdown.

dialogues.speaker: SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: Dallas 24, Washington 0.

dialogues.speaker: REDSKINS
dialogues.text: sitting in the stands look satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Redskins huddle. Shane is in pain.       He looks up at the clock.

dialogues.speaker: ON CLOCK
dialogues.text: There's thirty-two seconds left in the half. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Red right 15 X hook. The break the huddle and come to the line of scrimmage. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 X hut! Shane rolls right and looks downfield. He holds the ball and keeps rolling. No one can get open. Suddenly, Lamont cuts in front of him and yells: LAMONT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane! Lamont sees an open lane and Shane follows him. He eats up 15 yards before two defensive halfbacks close in. Lamont throws an incredible block and takes out both guys. Shane blows by and heads for the end zone. Only a safety stands between Shane and pay dirt.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: His side is killing him with every step he takes. When the safety moves up on him, Shane panics and goes down in the same kind of slide that Eddie Martel did in the beginning. Boom!   The GUN SOUNDS and the half ends. Shane sees Redskin trainers running out onto the field. He turns and sees Lamont rolling on the ground in pain as he holds his bad knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are doing their half-time stand up. AL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the end of the first half and not surprisingly, it was all Dallas. The Cowboys had over two hundred yards offensively versus Washington's frankly pathetic thirty-eight yards. That's total offense. Falco got close to scoring on the last play of the half but he appeared to have slipped. By the way, running back Roland Lamont was hurt on that play and word is he's on his way to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Al, the battle is being fought and won in the trenches. You can't expect a bunch of pick- up players to stand up to a professional pass rush like the Cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: BOOMER
dialogues.text: There's still a whole half left, Dan. And remember, Falco is proving to be a second- half quarterback.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: BOOMER
dialogues.text: Those big, fat boys in the trenches get awful tired. You ought to know that, Dan. No laughter.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Okay, let's join Chris Berman with our half- time show. Chris? After a beat we hear: DIRECTOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear!

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you guys?!

dialogues.speaker: BOOMER
dialogues.text: He started it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I did not! You called me fat!

dialogues.speaker: BOOMER
dialogues.text: I did not! But you are! Dan reaches across Al and grabs Boomer by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Stop it! The three of them start wrestling in the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is nursing a bruise or some sort of wound. Shane is nowhere to be seen. McGinty walks into the middle of the locker room. McGINTY Alright, listen up: The strike is officially over. They're announcing it on TV right now. So this is it, gentlemen. We have one half left to keep from being totally humiliated. You are better than the present score. You have nothing but your own self-respect riding on this game. It's up to you. Here's your swan song, people. How are you gonna sing it? And with that he walks out.     Everybody looks beaten and depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane stops two paramedics who push Roland Lamont on a stretcher. Roland is really hurting.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Roland. That was a great block.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: For my last play in football, I'll take that block. Shane looks terribly guilty.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to score. What happened? Did you slip? Shane can't look at him, but he nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: You were a warrior, Roland. I'm gonna miss you.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: It was a dream come true. Go kick some ass for me. The paramedics roll him away.     Shane slumps against the wall near tears. McGinty comes out of the locker room.     He locks eyes with Shane for a beat. And then McGinty turns his back on him and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is quiet.   Shane walks in. SID, the equipment manager, sees him and yells.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Hey, Shane, I just heard. Congratulations! He smacks Shane on his bad side and Shane grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINSON
dialogues.text: Congratulations on what?

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Shane is staying on. He's gonna be Martel's backup. Everyone stares at Shane for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRE
dialogues.text: Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Yes, Andre. It's true. Nobody says anything for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN
dialogues.text: I got to tell you, Shane, you played the first half like you were staying. Like you already had a contract. Shane looks around the room at this beaten bunch. No one makes eye contact with him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: You're right, Clifford. And I'm sorry. But now I want to go out there and either beat these bastards or die trying. I never wanted to beat anybody so bad in my life. Everybody lets this sink in. Earl Wilkinson finally speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: I don't know what yawl are doin' tomorrow, but my ass is goin' back to jail. But if I gotta go, I want to go back a winner.

dialogues.speaker: EVANS
dialogues.text: Hell, I'm retiring. I have thirty minutes of football left in my whole career. I'm homicidal!

dialogues.speaker: BATEMAN
dialogues.text: Me, too, Reese!

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Let's get it on! Everybody turns to Shane.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, our problem is the Cowboys aren't afraid of us. But they should be!

dialogues.speaker: LAMONT
dialogues.text: Damn straight! Everybody whoops!

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: We've got one chance on offense to make our stand -- the first play of the half.

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: One touchdown ain't gonna help, Shane. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     But one nasty-ass play    might. We just gotta    be brave. And trust    each other. Shane happens to glance at Pacifico. Pacifico won't meet his eye. Shane turns to Sid. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me with this. Sid helps Shane strip his jersey off. Everyone reacts to the bruises on Shane's side. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody has to tape me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cowboys are already back on the field as the Redskins come out of their locker room. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... at nine-forty Eastern time, the agreement was reached, and except for this upcoming second half, the strike is history.

dialogues.speaker: ON AL, DAN AND BOOMER
dialogues.text: Boomer's tie is off and his shirt is torn. Dan looks guilty, but still angry. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time. I say let the professionals back on the field. The fans deserve nothing less. BOOMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you would say that.

dialogues.speaker: ON BALL
dialogues.text: The Dallas kicker puts the ball in the end zone for a touchback.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He starts to follow the offense out on the field. Then he turns and sees Annabelle engrossed in a cheer. He runs over to her. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Is it your side? SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I owe you an apology. ANNABELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?     You do? SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'll explain later. But thank you for believing in me. You give me strength just looking at you. And with that, Shane takes her in his arms and kisses her deeply. The crowd on that side of the field reacts to the kiss with a "Wooooooo!" AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is a first. Shane Falco seems to be... BOOMER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell,    Al, he's necking with    a cheerleader! I've    done a little of that    in my time. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players are not supposed to fraternize with the cheerleaders. BOOMER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dan, what are they gonna do?   Fire him?!

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He breaks the kiss and looks up in the stands at Eddie Martel. Shane gives him the finger. The crowd goes "Wooooo!" at that too. Martel doesn't think this is funny. Shane walks onto the field leaving a confused but happy Annabelle. He walks past Dallas defensive lineman Butler. BUTLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't too smart. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck my dick. Butler is too shocked for a comeback.

dialogues.speaker: ON HUDDLE
dialogues.text: It breaks and Shane walks to the line of scrimmage. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go, first and ten for the Redskins. Twenty-four zip Dallas. We can see now that Wilkinson and Bateman are now part of the offense. They line up as receivers opposite defensive halfbacks. In fact, everyone but Shane is on the line of scrimmage, paired up across from a cowboy. Shane leans over Reese and takes in the Dallas defense. The Dallas MIDDLE LINEBACKER yells at Shane. LINEBACKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready for more pain, footsteps? Shane just smiles. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue thirteen! Blue thirteen! Hut! Hut! Hut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the snap, many things happen at once:

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: sticks his fingers inside Butler's face mask and pokes both eyes. Butler screams!

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: throws the ball as hard as he can at the middle Linebacker and hits him in the crotch. The guy grabs himself and collapses.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: kicks his defender in the shins as hard as he can. The defender screams and falls down.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: gets a cornerback across from him in a choke    hold. The guy can't breathe but Bateman holds on.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: lifts up his defender's face guard and connects with a right hand to the guy's chin.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: pulls the defensive lineman in front of him to the ground. Then he falls on him. The guy screams.

dialogues.speaker: ON FIELD
dialogues.text: All across the line of scrimmage, Redskins are punching, kicking and gouging the Dallas defense. WHISTLES BLOW.   Flags fly everywhere. Most of the Dallas players are down and screaming. Jamal stands across from a DEFENSIVE LINEMAN. He hasn't touched the guy. But he nods to the player to look at his hand. The guy looks down just as Jamal flicks open a deadly-looking switchblade. The guy jumps back and yells:

dialogues.speaker: DEFENDER
dialogues.text: He's got a knife! But there is so much confusion that nobody pays any attention. Jamal slips the knife away.

dialogues.speaker: AL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Whoa! Flags fly everywhere! I've never seen anything like this!

dialogues.speaker: BOOMER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Unbelievable! One Washington player had a Cowboy in what appeared to be a police choke hold.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I see at least five flags... no six! The officials are going crazy trying     to figure out the penalties as Shane and     the offense back up and make room for the     Dallas medical staff who come running out on     the field. Some Dallas players are livid:

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: (to the Ref) He scratched my eyes out! LINEBACKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hit me on purpose! ON McGINTY He's smiling to himself on the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: ON REFEREE
dialogues.text: He faces the cameras, turns on his microphone and sums up the penalties. REF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsportsmanlike conduct, number 72, number 81 and number 87 on the offense, fifteen yards... (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... times three... that's forty-five yards. Illegal use of hands, number 48 on the offense, fifteen yards. That makes it sixty yards. Unnecessary roughness number 65 and number 32, fifteen yards... that's, wait... forty-five... no, thirty... (turns to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: another ref)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... how many yards so far?

dialogues.speaker: ON BALL
dialogues.text: A ref is taking a very long walk with it. He stops at the Redskin two-yard line and puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: IN HUDDLE
dialogues.text: Shane leans in. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody, stick together and don't take any shit. Let's make 'em hurt! They break the huddle and line up with their backs to their goal.

dialogues.speaker: ON COCHRAN AND BUTLER
dialogues.text: Butler is still whining. BUTLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you went for my eyes! COCHRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! I'm gonna do it again 'cause it was fun!

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black 98! Black 98! Hut!

dialogues.speaker: ON COCHRAN
dialogues.text: He drops Butler with a vicious forearm. Shane flicks the ball over the middle to Murray who pulls it in for fifteen yards and a first down.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: (now at running back) sweeps outside with Jamal and Reese Evans leading the way. Both linemen growl as they throw themselves into the defense.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: is rolling right with Butler on his heels. Just when it looks like Butler has him, Cochran comes out of nowhere and cuts Butler at the knees. Shane fakes a throw and keeps the ball for a fifteen- yard gain.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: hits Franklin with a short flick pass.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: runs off tackle and scores.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: kicks the extra point.     Scoreboard: Dallas 24, Redskins 7.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: blitzes from his safety position and decks the Dallas quarterback.

dialogues.speaker: G
dialogues.text: stops a runner at the line of scrimmage and throws him for a loss.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: takes a punt at his own thirty. With Bateman blocking, Wilkinson springs to the outside and goes all the way for a touchdown. Pacifico kicks the extra point. Scoreboard: Dallas 24, Redskins 14.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: is set to boot one. The ball is snapped, the kicker moves forward and suddenly Brian Murray breaks through the offense and blocks the kick.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: hits Franklin on a little down and out. He's hit by the defender, the ball goes flying but so does a flag. Pass interference.   Redskin first down.

dialogues.speaker: K
dialogues.text: Four minutes six seconds remain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Redskin huddle breaks.   The guys come to the line of scrimmage. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First and ten at the Cowboy twenty and I'm telling you, we are looking at a totally different team here in the second half. BOOMER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely, Al. The Redskins are playing like there's no tomorrow, because, hey, there isn't! DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta agree with you on this one. The surprising thing for me is how ineffectual the Cowboys have been in this half. I mean, they look totally intimidated. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love when you guys agree.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He's in the shotgun calling signals. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hut!   Hut! He gets the snap and starts looking downfield for receivers.

dialogues.speaker: ON COCHRAN
dialogues.text: He slips while he's blocking Butler who takes advantage of the situation and blows by him.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He's got Franklin crossing in the end zone. He cocks and throws, and simultaneously gets decked by Butler.

dialogues.speaker: ON BALL
dialogues.text: A Dallas defensive halfback     goes up for    it but just tips the ball. It      keeps going    now end over end... right into     the waiting    arms of Franklin who is standing     by himself    in the end zone. Franklin is shocked.   His teammates run INTO FRAME and mob him. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touchdown, Skins!     What a fluke! BOOMER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total luck there, Al. Makes up for the perfect ones they drop. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not so lucky. Falco is down.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He's on his back.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: She looks worried as trainers run out onto the field.

dialogues.speaker: ON O'NEIL AND AUGUSTINE
dialogues.text: They're watching in O'Neil's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: Trainers are bending over him.      He's out but he's mumbling:

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Put your tits on my head... A trainer hears that and looks worried. Shane's teammates run up and carry him off the field.

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANKLIN
dialogues.text: He's holding for Pacifico on the extra point. On the snap, Franklin bobbles the ball but manages to put it down. Pacifico belts it through the uprights. Scoreboard:    Dallas 24, Washington 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is sitting on the bench holding his head and his side. He's talking quietly to McGinty.

dialogues.speaker: ON WILKINSON
dialogues.text: He's on the field calling for a fair catch. He makes it.

dialogues.speaker: AL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... one minute twenty remaining, and even though Dallas didn't score, they sure ate up a lot of the clock.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINSON
dialogues.text: He's leading the offense out onto the field.

dialogues.speaker: BOOMER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And it looks like Falco cannot answer the bell. He's still on the bench and it    appears that safety    Earl Wilkinson will be    leading the Redskin    offense. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just need to get the ball in field goal range. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for Pacifico, that's anything up to sixty-five yards.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINSON
dialogues.text: He takes the snap from the shotgun and keeps the ball on a sweep. He plows for twelve yards. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good for twelve yards. The clock stops on the first down. The Redskins have no time- outs left.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: McGinty is still bent over him. McGINTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your hands in there for the field goal. I can't trust Franklin to hold. He almost dropped the extra point. Shane is in major pain but nods his head. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: ON WILKINSON
dialogues.text: He rolls again, but no one is open. He crosses the line of scrimmage, is hit and goes down.

dialogues.speaker: ON CLOCK
dialogues.text: It continues to run and passes twenty seconds as we watch.

dialogues.speaker: ON REDSKINS
dialogues.text: They're hurrying back to the line of scrimmage. Wilkinson stands over center. On the snap, Wilkinson throws the ball out of bounds. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkinson throws it away, and with twelve seconds remaining, the Redskins will try a forty-eight yard field goal to tie it up. That's almost a chip shot for Pacifico.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He shakily follows Pacifico out onto the field. Reese Evans catches up with him. EVANS (to Shane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make it a good snap. (to Pacifico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll do the rest, right? Pacifico doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: ON BALL
dialogues.text: Evans leans over it.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
dialogues.text: He's kneeling in the middle of the field waiting for the snap. But something is bothering him. SHANE (to Pacifico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou, are you alright? Pacifico looks up from where he is set up for the kick. There are tears in his eyes. PACIFICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. They know where my family lives. Shane tries to digest what he just heard. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! EVANS (through his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: legs) Come on, Shane! Shane looks back at Pacifico and makes a decision. SHANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hut! The ball is snapped perfectly.      Shane catches it and spots it perfectly. Pacifico moves to kick it. And Shane pulls the ball away. Pacifico flies through the air like Snoopy as he kicks nothing but air. He lands hard. Shane jumps to his feet and starts running. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fake! Falco has it! ON McGINTY He's in shock.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHANE
